Package view

Class GameView

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • view.GameView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class GameView
extends javafx.application.Application
implements java.util.Observer
    this is the view for once the game has begun. handles all clicking, GUI controlling, etc. Also contains the game loop, which handles tower attacks, moving enemies and drawing everything in the game

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  GameView.ButtonHandler
      handles all of the game option button clicking by implementing an EventHandler

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javafx.application.Application

      void dragDrop​(javafx.scene.image.ImageView image)
      handles all of the tower dragging and dropping.
      void drawEnemy​()
      draws every enemy on the map given where they are moving, and if they are effected by a tower.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameView

        public GameView​(Player player)
        constructs the view and initializes all necessary global variables. adds observers to appropriate model classes.
        Parameters:
        player - Creates a game view with a given player, who is playing on a GameMap.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        launches application with the given args
        Parameters:
        args - a list of arguments

      • start

        public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        initializes all buttons, canvas and graphics, the shop, draws the map and sets/shows the scene
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - the stage that we will be setting

      • drawTower

        public void drawTower​()
        draws all the towers currently on the map. if tower is attacking, draw the attack animation.

      • drawEnemy

        public void drawEnemy​()
        draws every enemy on the map given where they are moving, and if they are effected by a tower. If an enemy is being attacked by a tower, draws the tower explosion gif depending on which tower is attacking the enemy.

      • drawMap

        public void drawMap​()
        draws our entire map by drawing all the tiles in the GameMap map object's grid and calling drawEnemy() and drawTower()

      • stat

        public javafx.scene.layout.HBox stat​()
        public HBox stat() - builds an HBox for all of the game stats and returns it
        Returns:
        HBox containing all the player stats such as gold, health, score etc.

      • shop

        public javafx.scene.layout.VBox shop​()
        creates a VBox for the shop area and returns it
        Returns:
        VBox containing all the tower pictures. Hover over a tower to see the stats. Drag a tower onto the map to place it given it is a valid location and player has the funds

      • dragDrop

        public void dragDrop​(javafx.scene.image.ImageView image)
        handles all of the tower dragging and dropping. drag a tower from the VBox on the left onto the map to place it given player has the funds and the location is valid. Also shows a "ghost" image of the tower whilst dragging for increased ease of use.
        Parameters:
        image - the image that is being used for the drag drop ghosting feature

      • update

        public void update​(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        if the update is instanceof Player, updates the players stats, else if instanceof GameMap updates the map. then redraws the game. this is ran whenever a model object is modified and the (this) observer is notified.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        o - the instance object that is being updated
        arg - unused
